definition: mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: The moving average was last breached in July.
sentences.chinese: 移動平均線最近跌破關口還是在7月。

sentences.english: Chengdu is a backpacker’s paradise as well as the business gateway to Western China.
sentences.chinese: 成都不但是中國西部的商業關口，還是揹包客的天堂。

sentences.english: After arriving at Macao, you should be able to go through the customs check point anytime before 12.
sentences.chinese: 到達澳門後，澳門的關口12點之前都能出關的。

sentences.english: Know ye the celestials pass through the pure flame.
sentences.chinese: 經過純的火焰你知道天上的關口。

sentences.english: The pass itself is dotted with prayer flags and there are several herds of yak around.
sentences.chinese: 這個關口到處都經幡，附近還有幾個犛牛羣。

sentences.english: The Management Committee of the People's Commune of Chengguan Town, XX County.
sentences.chinese: “城關”是一個縣城的關口的意思，直譯即可。

sentences.english: He always keeps a close eye on latest domestic news.
sentences.chinese: 他密切的關口國內最舊的音訊。

sentences.english: Our global population has just reached seven billion.
sentences.chinese: 世界人口突破七十億關口了。

sentences.english: The gateway is the cross to get to Me.
sentences.chinese: 投奔我的關口是十字架的苦難。

sentences.english: When they got to Customs, she let the priest go ahead of her.
sentences.chinese: 當他們走到關口時，女士讓牧師走帶她前面。

sentences.english: Canada is a convenient spring-board for entry to the US market.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大是投資美國市場的便利關口。

sentences.english: Once the barrier is breached, losses are incurred on a one-for-one basis.
sentences.chinese: 一旦突破了這個關口，損失是逐次計算的。

sentences.english: How can you stand by and watch while your allies are attacked?
sentences.chinese: 當你們的盟朋逢到攻擊之時，你們又怎能漠不關口呢？
滬指2000點關口再次接受壓力測試。

sentences.english: Technically, HSI failed to hold 18000 level, suggesting trend remains weak.
sentences.chinese: 技術上，恆指失守18000關口，反映走勢仍偏淡。

sentences.english: We can see many mountians around.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以看到許多的關口。

definition: strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
checkpoint (for taxation, security etc)/barrier/hurdle/red tape/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
Hang Seng index (of Hong Kong stock market)
to touch (physically, one's feelings etc)/to touch on (a topic)
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
